annotate.dropdown: Search for a channel or the name of a video from this channel
annotate.p1: Below you see a list of YouTube channels. To help us understand whether and how YouTube is sometimes used as a source of news, please let us know to what extent you yourself consider these channels to be informative.
annotate.p2: Do any other news related channels come to mind that are not listed here? If so, please select them in the following search box. Selected channels will be added to the table above.
annotate.pleaseanswer: Please answer all questions to contine
annotate.question: Does this channel cover content about news and current affairs?

confirm.consent1: I have seen that I can search and delete items from my data, and understand that all items that have not been deleted will be submitted for donation
confirm.consent2: I have seen the explanation of how and for what purpose my data will be used, and give my consent to use it for this purpose

donated.failure: Failed to submit {{filename}} data. Please try again, and contact the researchers or survey company if the problem persists

confirm.header: Please confirm that you understand and agree with the following conditions
confirm.testuser: You are logged in as a test user, so your real data won't be submitted. The server will only see what types of data you submitted, and how many items

info.p1: We probably need to tell participants a little story or something about how and for what purpose we'll use their data. Before the actual donation (in the 'Complete donation') step people will then need to verify that they have seen this and give consent.

remove.list1: Type one search term per row
remove.list3: Terms needs to be at least 3 characters long

validate.header1: To use your data for research, it's important to know how accurate it is. Please help us by answering a few questions about your data
validate.header2: On the left you see the top items in your {{dataname}} data. Please answer the following questions to help us understand how accurate this data.
validate.question1: Do you feel that you recognize this digital footprint as your own?
validate.question2: Are the largest items indeed the items you often visit?
validate.question3: Are there any items that you know you visited often, but are not shown here?
validate.question4: Is this data only yours, or does someone else use your device or account?

deleteButton.content1: Do you want to delete all the gathered data from the browser?
deleteButton.content2: Note that any data you downloaded will still be on your computer, so you might want to delete that as well

donate.description: Support academic research by sharing your data

donateCard.name: Donate

status.any: Some of the data types are not yet (successfull) gathered. You can continue, but some data will be missing

donateCard.subname: Click here to go to the donation screen

removeCard.name: Exclude data
removeCard.subname: Use keywords to search and remove any data that you prefer not to share

donate.title: Donate

explore.description: This step is optional, but aren't you curious?
explore.title: Explore

gather.description: Click a card to gather your data

finalStep.step3: Click and hold the folder/file, and drag it into the blue field below

gatherCard.click: Click here to gather the data that Google has about your browsing, search and Youtube history

gather.title: Gather

first.content1: The first step is to click on a card in the Gather column on the left. This will walk you through the steps for gathering this data and loading it into this application.
first.content2: At this point, the data will only be stored on your own device. You can then first use this application to explore your data, and you can also choose to exlude data that you do not want to donate.
first.header: Get started by gathering some data

second.content1: First, you can explore your data. This step is optional, so if you just want to donate your data you can skip it.
second.content2: Second, you can donate you data. If you click the donate card, we will walk you through the steps. You can also first click the exclude data card, which lets you search and delete items from your data that you don't want to share.
second.header: Now that you have data, you can do two things

routing.leavemessage: Are you sure you want to leave? All data will be lost.

welcome.header: Welcome to the Digital Footprints Lab!

notpersistent.header: If possible, use a different browser
notpersistent.p: This application works best in recent versions of Chrome, Safari, Edge, Firefox and Opera. For some browsers, like Firefox, it works better when not in private mode. You can still use the application with your current browser, but your data won't be stored if you leave. Don't worry though! you'll get a warning when you try to refresh or leave the page so this doesn't easily happen by accident.

welcome.p1: This application let's you collect and explore your own digital traces. All the data is stored and processed on your own device, so it doesn't touch the internet.
welcome.p2: You can also donate a selection of this data for scientific research. This data will only be used for non-commercial research by a select group of academics, for research that is approved by the ethical board of their university.
welcome.subheader1: Gather and explore your digital footprints
welcome.subheader2: Donate data to support academic research

testuser.p1: The link that brought you to this website did not contain a user ID. If you are participating in a study, this should not be possible, and you should contact the researchers or survey company.
testuser.p2: As a test user your real data will not be send to a server. If you complete the data donation steps, the server will receive a dummy submission with fake data.
